segment.source: Migration Store Encryption (Windows 10)
segment.target: Migration Store Encryption (Windows 10)

segment.source: Migration Store Encryption
segment.target: Migration Store Encryption

segment.source: Migration Store Encryption
segment.target: Migration Store Encryption

segment.source: This topic discusses User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 options for migration store encryption to protect the integrity of user data during a migration.
segment.target: This topic discusses User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 options for migration store encryption to protect the integrity of user data during a migration.

segment.source: USMT Encryption Options
segment.target: USMT Encryption Options

segment.source: USMT enables support for stronger encryption algorithms, called Advanced Encryption Standard (AES), in several bit-level options.
segment.target: USMT enables support for stronger encryption algorithms, called Advanced Encryption Standard (AES), in several bit-level options.

segment.source: AES is a National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) specification for the encryption of electronic data.
segment.target: AES is a National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) specification for the encryption of electronic data.

segment.source: The encryption algorithm you choose must be specified for both the ScanState and the LoadState commands, so that these commands can create or read the store during encryption and decryption.
segment.target: The encryption algorithm you choose must be specified for both the ScanState and the LoadState commands, so that these commands can create or read the store during encryption and decryption.

segment.source: The new encryption algorithms can be specified on the ScanState and the LoadState command lines by using the /encrypt:"encryptionstrength" and the /decrypt:"encryptionstrength" command-line options.
segment.target: The new encryption algorithms can be specified on the ScanState and the LoadState command lines by using the /encrypt:"encryptionstrength" and the /decrypt:"encryptionstrength" command-line options.

segment.source: All of the encryption application programming interfaces (APIs) used by USMT are available in Windows 7, Windows 8, and Windows 10 operating systems.
segment.target: All of the encryption application programming interfaces (APIs) used by USMT are available in Windows 7, Windows 8, and Windows 10 operating systems.

segment.source: However, export restrictions might limit the set of algorithms that are available to computers in certain locales.
segment.target: However, export restrictions might limit the set of algorithms that are available to computers in certain locales.

segment.source: You can use the Usmtutils.exe file to determine which encryption algorithms are available to the computers' locales before you begin the migration.
segment.target: You can use the Usmtutils.exe file to determine which encryption algorithms are available to the computers' locales before you begin the migration.

segment.source: The following table describes the command-line encryption options in USMT.
segment.target: The following table describes the command-line encryption options in USMT.

segment.source: Component
segment.target: Component

segment.source: Option
segment.target: Option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: ScanState
segment.target: ScanState

segment.source: /encryptAES, AES_128, AES_192, AES_256, 3DES, 3DES_112
segment.target: /encryptAES, AES_128, AES_192, AES_256, 3DES, 3DES_112

segment.source: This option and argument specify that the migration store is encrypted and which algorithm to use.
segment.target: This option and argument specify that the migration store is encrypted and which algorithm to use.

segment.source: When the algorithm argument is not provided, the ScanState tool employs the 3DES algorithm.
segment.target: When the algorithm argument is not provided, the ScanState tool employs the 3DES algorithm.

segment.source: LoadState
segment.target: LoadState

segment.source: /decryptAES, AES_128, AES_192, AES_256, 3DES, 3DES_112
segment.target: /decryptAES, AES_128, AES_192, AES_256, 3DES, 3DES_112

segment.source: This option and argument specify that the store must be decrypted and which algorithm to use.
segment.target: This option and argument specify that the store must be decrypted and which algorithm to use.

segment.source: When the algorithm argument is not provided, the LoadState tool employs the 3DES algorithm.
segment.target: When the algorithm argument is not provided, the LoadState tool employs the 3DES algorithm.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Some encryption algorithms may not be available on your systems.
segment.target: Some encryption algorithms may not be available on your systems.

segment.source: You can verify which algorithms are available by running the UsmtUtils command with the /ec option.
segment.target: You can verify which algorithms are available by running the UsmtUtils command with the /ec option.

segment.source: For more information see UsmtUtils Syntax
segment.target: For more information see UsmtUtils Syntax
